artist: Lucien Lévy-Dhurmer; Manufacturer: Manufactured by Clément Massier
creditline: The Decorative Arts Miscellaneous Purchase Fund
markings: impressed/stamped mark on base: CLEMENT MASSIER / GOLFE JUAN / (A.M.) / L LEVY
signed: handwritten on base, yellow pigment: CLEMENT MASSIER / GOLFE JUAN / (AM)
text:
Lustreware (pottery with a metallic iridescent glaze) was pioneered in the Middle East, in

Abbasid Iraq, during the 9th century. This vase, made a millennium later, alludes to this context with its

depiction of scimitars and tassels, associated with Islam since the Middle Ages. The decoration is handetched

by the Symbolist artist Lucien Lévy-Dhurmer, who may also have been alluding to his own upbringing

in Algiers.
title: Vase with scimitars
